result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khari K Deans

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM Defendant Khari K Deans in court.  Attorney Frank Joseph Schiro and Atty Leif in court for Khari K Deans.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schiro address the motion to dismiss on this matter and makes a few statements to the court. 
State makes a statement to the court as to the motion. 
Atty Schiro makes a follow up statement. 
Court denies the motion to dismiss for reasons stated on the record. 
State had filed an information.
Atty Schiro does accept receipt of the information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Atty Schiro requests his motion to suppress be scheduled.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:12 AM Defendant Khari K Deans in court.  Attorney Frank Joseph Schiro and attorney Kristin Leaf in court for Khari K Deans.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Kyle Knapp, of the Village of Butler Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Schiro.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over based upon the testimony of the officer.  
Defense moves for dismissal and presents arguments.  
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State responses to defense arguments noting these arguments should be brought forth by a suppression motion.  
Waive reading of Information.  
Attorney Schiro requests a date for arraignment.
Court sets arraignment before the Trial Court.
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:15 AM Defendant Khari K Deans appeared by video.  Attorney Frank Joseph Schiro appeared by zoom video for Khari K Deans by zoom video.  District Attorney Law Intern in court for State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Request to appear via zoom.  
**Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 08-08-2022. "Granted"
Attorney Frank Schiro

Hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:21 AM Defendant Khari K Deans in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the Defendant's was not granted an order appointing counsel due to not listing any expenses on his Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.
Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
IF THE DEFENDANT HAS AN ATTORNEY BY THE NEXT COURT DATE - THE COURT WILL AUTHORIZES ZOOM.

The State gives a new bond recommendation as a felony count was added.
The Court will not change bail at this time.
  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court denies petition to appoint counsel, signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on July 5, 2022
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Defendant re: Petition or Appointment of an Attorney

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

filed by defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:29 AM Defendant Khari K Deans in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
